channel.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
channel.description:
There was a bug with the minecraft server that allowed anyone to view the full plain-text passwords of the last few people that logged in. So I reset the passwords for everyone that had a minecraft name set, better safe than sorry I suppose.
If you haven't reset your password yet, do so here: http://www.moparcraft.net/smf/index.php?action=reminder

item.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

If anyone ever struggles, remember:

http://www.moparcraft.net/smf/index.php/topic,492512.0.html

update: added how to set a password for moparcraft etc

Read full topic

item.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Stiflex:

could anyone PM or tell me howto make a password/register for the server? cause im using my details (the details of this acc) and it says invalid password

You have to set your minecraft name.

[quote=“badger41, post:30, topic:410437”][quote author=Stiflex link=topic=511722.msg3737975#msg3737975 date=1315083113]
could anyone PM or tell me howto make a password/register for the server? cause im using my details (the details of this acc) and it says invalid password
[/quote]

go to your profile and set your minecraft password under the minecraft username field[/quote]

Setting the minecraft password is optional. (it falls back to your forum password)

Read full topic

item.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you are concerned about your forum password being compromised again (why shouldn’t you be?), now you can set a password specifically for your minecraft server account here:
http://www.moparcraft.net/smf/index.php?action=profile;area=forumprofile

And then use that to /login with on the server. That way, the worst that could ever happen is that password could be compromised, and we would have to roll back the bad guy and ask you to change your password.

If you do not set that field, you can continue to log in with your forum password just as before, and I will try my best to keep them secure, but I can’t 100% guarantee it (since I don’t write the minecraft software).

@compromised passwords, I will be restoring all of the passwords not yet reset to their previous values, if you haven’t recovered your password in this amount of time, you either don’t care to, or can’t.

edit:

whattehp406:

Wait, does this mean our passwords were stored as plain text?

Of course I would never store them as plain text, but a certain plugin did record ‘/login’ commands for everyone to see…

Read full topic

item.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Well, even though I reported them to the proper people, none of these bugs are being fixed. I think I’m going to switch from BigBrother to:

GitHub

oliverwoodings/HawkEye

HawkEye - Bukkit data logging plugin with web-based data browser

Hopefully tomorrow…

Also the server is up and running with limited plugins, feel free to do whatever the hell you want, no rules on the server until I get it rolled back and up and running properly tomorrow!

Read full topic

item.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Moparisthebest:

They didn’t/couldn’t just ‘download’ them, they could, at any time, see the passwords of the last few people that logged in on the minecraft chat. I’ll be posting a full explanation when it is all fixed.

Do you have a rough estimate on how much longer it will be until the server will be online again?

Read full topic

item.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

omgilikepie:

I would say it matters. If they downloaded them, then they probably have them all stored on their computer somewhere. If they were just looking at them through the game, then they probably only picked out a couple that they wanted. I doubt they would have taken the time to write it all down or something. Yes, he said that the bug/exploit was about user passwords, but he had to give us at least the much information so that we would know why all our passwords got changed. Telling us that, and how they did it is completely two different things. Why would he want to tell somewhere where they needed to look/what they needed to do to create similar problems in the future. Nothing is ever 100% secure, so why risk it.

A wise one once told me, 'Playing it safe is the most popular way to fail". Also, None of our passwords were change (that we know of), only on the fact that MITB wrote a fast script that would blank out everybodies passwords that have a minecraft username set in their profile. He did this because he found out passwords were viewable. Also, telling people how only provokes them to try out other ways with simular measures. Don’t tell them, and they stay clueless.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
item.dc:creator: @carecarecare carecarecare
item.description:
@carecarecare wrote:

He has told us about how previous bugs were done, starting the sentence with “Well, since it’s already fixed I might as well tell you”.

Read full topic

item.description:
@omgilikepie wrote:

I would say it matters. If they downloaded them, then they probably have them all stored on their computer somewhere. If they were just looking at them through the game, then they probably only picked out a couple that they wanted. I doubt they would have taken the time to write it all down or something. Yes, he said that the bug/exploit was about user passwords, but he had to give us at least the much information so that we would know why all our passwords got changed. Telling us that, and how they did it is completely two different things. Why would he want to tell somewhere where they needed to look/what they needed to do to create similar problems in the future. Nothing is ever 100% secure, so why risk it.

item.title: Forum/Server passwords compromised
item.dc:creator: @carecarecare carecarecare
item.description:
@carecarecare wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:15, topic:410437”][quote author=ReptarXD link=topic=511722.msg3714058#msg3714058 date=1313527174]
What do you mean other people could just “download” our password? And how?
[/quote]
Nobody said anything about downloading passwords, just tgat there was a way to view them from within the moparcraft server. Also, why would they tell you how? Its better to keep how a secret so nobody goes sniffing for another glitch.[/quote]
Why wouldn’t they? He’s already told everyone that there was a bug on obtaining passwords, so telling them how they accomplished wouldn’t hurt. He’s even testing to make sure the server is fixed to its fullest.
And honestly, why does it matter that he said “downloading” instead of viewing? Was it really worth pointing out?

Read full topic
